wpPost.title: How to Create Downloadable Products in Magento 2
wpPost.content:
How to create downloadable products in Magento 2: A downloadable product is a digital item that customers can easily access in the form of a file, such as an eBook, music, video, software application, or update. For example, you can sell individual songs from an album. Additionally, a downloadable product can also be used to deliver an electronic version of your product catalog. The process of creating a downloadable product in Magento 2 is simple.

When setting up a downloadable product in Magento 2, you have the flexibility to choose whether your customers need to log in to access the download link, or if the link will be sent via email for them to share with others. To get a better understanding of how to create a Magento 2 downloadable product, follow the basic field guidelines provided below. Once all the necessary settings have been configured and saved, you can then proceed to add images and additional product information as required.

How to create Downloadable Products in Magento 2: A Comprehensive Guide

Follow these steps to create a Downloadable Product in Magento 2:

7 Simple Steps for Creating Downloadable Products in Magento 2

Step 1: Choose the Product Type

  •  Go to the Admin sidebar, and navigate to Products > Inventory > Catalog.
  •  In the upper-right corner of the Add Product menu, choose Downloadable Product as the product type.

Step 2: Choose a Product Template (Optional)

The Downloadable field is a special field for downloadable products. Select a product template using one of these methods:

  •  Use the Search box to search for the template by name.
  •  Choose a template from the list.

The corresponding form will appear for configuration.

Step 3: Complete Required Fields

  •  In the Product Details section, complete the following:

             1. Enter a Name for the product.

             2. Use the default SKU or provide a custom value.

             3. Enter the Price.

  •  At this point, the product is not yet ready to be published. Leave the Product Online    option set to Off.
  •  Click Save to complete this step.

Step 4: Complete Additional Product Details

  •  Set the Tax Class to either None or Taxable Goods. For information on tax requirements for digital goods and services, refer to the white paper “Identification & Taxability of Digital Products” on the Avalara website.
  •  To add an image for the product group, use one of the following methods:

1. Drag and drop an image from your desktop onto the Camera tile in the Images and Videos box.

2. In the Images and Video box, click the Camera tile and choose the desired image from your computer’s files.

A placeholder will appear until a product image is uploaded.

  •  Specify the Quantity of the product.
  •  If necessary, leave the Weight field blank and check the Virtual/Downloadable checkbox.
  •  To assign the product to a Category, use one of the following methods:

  1. Type the name in the Search box to find and select a match.

  2. Click the Show List icon to view the category tree and select any available category to assign to the product.

  3. Create a new category by entering the Category Name, assigning it to a Parent Category, and clicking Create     Category.

  •  Add a product description if desired, and then click Submit. You can also use the WYSIWYG Editor for more control.

Step 5: Complete the Downloadable Information

The Downloadable Information is divided into two parts. The first part is a link to the download, and the second part provides a description of each sample file. Many of these options can be set as default values in the configuration.

5.1. Link

  •  In the Links section, provide a Title for the download links.
  •  Set the “Links can be purchased separately” option to offer single or multiple download links.
  •  Click on “Add New Link” and then:

1. Enter the Title and Price for the download.

2. Select the desired distribution method: Attach File (File) or Enter Link (URL).

3. Choose “Yes” for “Sharable” if customers must log in to their account before accessing the download link. If “No”, customers will receive a link via email that they can share with others.

4. Take one of the following actions:

    A. To limit the number of downloads per customer, enter the Max Downloads.

    B. To allow unlimited downloads, check the Unlimited checkbox.

  •  Repeat these steps if you need to add more links by clicking “Add New Link” again.
  •  In the Samples section, provide a Title for the samples you want to use.
  •  Click on “Add New Link” to fill in the sample information.

            1. Enter the Title of the individual sample.

            2. Select the desired distribution method: Attach File (File) or Enter Link (URL).

Downloadable product file names can contain letters and numbers. You can use either a dash or underscore to represent a space between words. Any invalid characters in the file name will be replaced with an underscore.

  •  Repeat these steps if you need to add more sample links by clicking “Add New Link” again.
  •  Rearrange the samples by dragging the sort icon to a new position.

Step 6: Publish the Product

How to create downloadable products in Magento 2

  •  Once you have completed all the necessary information and configurations, turn on the “Product Online” switch to make the product available in the catalog.
  •  Click “Save & Close” to finalize the product.

Step 7: Preview the Product in Your Store

From the Admin menu, select “Customer View” to see how the product will appear to customers in your store.

Conclusion

To sum it up, Magento 2 has made creating downloadable products a hassle-free process with its in-built support. By following the step-by-step instructions provided above on how to create downloadable products in Magento 2, you can effortlessly generate download links and free samples for your products. Should you run into any difficulties during the process, feel free to seek assistance.

Magento 2’s ability to create downloadable products is a valuable feature that enables merchants to offer digital products such as eBooks, music, videos, and software applications for purchase on their online store. With the flexibility to require customers to log in to access download links or allow them to share links via email, downloadable products in Magento 2 offer a seamless and convenient buying experience for customers.

In conclusion, by leveraging Magento 2’s powerful capabilities, you can easily create and sell downloadable products, expanding your product offerings and catering to the digital needs of your customers. Additionally, for more information on configuring other types of products, such as How to configure and design Product Labels in Magento 2, additional tutorials can be found.
